paragraphs.name: a6cd
paragraphs.text: A president who lost the popular vote by 2,864,974 nominated Neil Gorsuch to serve a lifetime appointment on the nation’s highest Court. Although a bloc of senators representing at least 53 percent of the country oppose this nominee, Gorsuch is all but certain to be confirmed — after a bit of a showdown over the Senate’s rules.

8f744e2a8e85.title: Elimination of the filibuster is certainly be a step in the right direction.

paragraphs.text: Elimination of the filibuster is certainly be a step in the right direction. Another option would have been to return to the days when filibusters had to be physically carried out. Everything had to come to a halt and senators had to hold the floor and keep ranting for the duration. Those rules, which were abandoned in the 1970s, were why filibusters…
paragraphs.name: 3b0f

96cca68015e.title: We need to go further than that.

paragraphs.text: We need to go further than that. We need proportional representation on a per-party basis. There needs to be some type of “per party block group”, say every 10k, 20k, whatever, group of registered voters that party automatically gets a seat. Then it is up to the party to elect who they want to fill it. This should be on a national, truly federal…

virtuals.subtitle: You would see huge increase in voters, much more participation, and many new parties would emerge. We could have a true representative…

paragraphs.name: f4f0

b1d8b778239e.title: The filibuster is just one more example that for anything gained or lost there is either a positive…

paragraphs.text: The filibuster is just one more example that for anything gained or lost there is either a positive or negative offset. The filabuster has protected both bad thing and good things. But in an ever faster changing world, on balance, it has prevented government from keeping up.
paragraphs.name: 81e9

virtuals.subtitle: Yes, it has often prevent rash decisions from becoming law, but the negative offset has been grid lock — pick your poison.

content.subtitle: Yes, it has often prevent rash decisions from becoming law, but the negative offset has been grid lock — pick your poison.

8902dda4e633.title: Skipping past the argle bargle in the article: The Founders conceived of the United States as a…

paragraphs.text: Skipping past the argle bargle in the article: The Founders conceived of the United States as a union of states, not a democracy. The ONLY democratic institution in the Constitution was the House of Representatives. And, at the time, the people eligible to vote were free white men over the age of 21 who owned substantial property.
